Tasks.Task Description: Gather detailed requirements for the containerized application, including resource needs (CPU, memory), storage, and networking. Identify the container images to be used and their source (e.g., Azure Container Registry, Docker Hub).
Plan the architecture for deploying containers, including the number of instances, scaling requirements, and integration with other Azure services such as Azure Virtual Network or Azure Key Vault.
If using Azure Container Registry, create and configure the registry to store container images. Ensure proper access controls and permissions are in place.
Secure necessary approvals and authorizations for deploying Azure Container Instances, including budgetary and compliance approvals.
Deploy the container instances using the Azure portal, CLI, or ARM templates. Specify the container image, resource requirements, and networking configurations.
Set up networking for the container instances, including Virtual Network integration, DNS settings, and firewall rules. Ensure secure communication between containers and other Azure services.

Enable security features such as managed identities, secure environment variables, and encryption for data in transit and at rest. Configure role-based access control (RBAC) for managing access to the container instances.
Perform functional and performance testing of the deployed containers. Validate that the application behaves as expected and meets performance requirements.
Configure monitoring for the container instances using Azure Monitor or other tools. Set up alerts for resource usage, application errors, and other critical metrics.
Create detailed documentation for the deployment process, including architecture diagrams, configurations, and operational procedures. Share the documentation with relevant stakeholders.
Provide training to the operations team on managing and troubleshooting Azure Container Instances. Include best practices for scaling, monitoring, and security.
Develop a backup and recovery plan for container configurations and data. Ensure that the plan is tested and meets business continuity requirements.
Schedule and conduct regular audits to ensure compliance with security and operational standards. Review access controls, resource usage, and application performance.
